Articles.Content:
One small question:  

What''s difference between your mod FPSLimiter & using Game FPS limiter ? beside have quick access in game with out goo in setting ?

& i am intrigue how it can be done live switching / changing with out make game crash O.o usual something like this was require a full restart ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png ":o") witch is great ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif ":cool:")

Thx & sorry in case i set a question what my be you already ....

> 
> 
> Just now, Blacks said:
> 
> 
> One small question:  
> 
> What''s difference between your mod FPSLimiter & using Game FPS limiter ? beside have quick access in game with out goo in setting ?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> & i am intrigue how it can be done live switching / changing with out make game crash O.o usual something like this was require a full restart ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png ":o") witch is great ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif ":cool:")
> 
> 
> 
> Thx & sorry in case i set a question what my be you already ....
> 

Well for one the kerbal settings only allows you to set it to 60,80 and 120. While my mod allows you to set it to any value you like. As a bonus it has another setting which can be used to limit the game fps while its in the background to reduce CPU & GPU load.

well using other value beside 30, 60 like increment & it was suppose to be 90 it can cause usual problem from what i know but my be i am wrong, anyway most certainly it will goo on my list to test & must be use special it can be done live direct in game, what can serve on my future test!!!!! all i hope to not influence in bad way game engine what is already, let say to be gentle so fragile on this moment ![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif ":rolleyes:")

thx for replay

New update out.

We merged RecoverAll and DestroyAll into this!

PhysicalTimeRatioViewer and ModifiedExplosionPotential are now updated to 1.1.1.
Any news about  **AutoBalancingLandingLeg**? Thanks for the work on Kerbokatz!

> 
> 
> 9 hours ago, Crabman said:
> 
> 
> Any news about  **AutoBalancingLandingLeg**? Thanks for the work on Kerbokatz!
> 

Last i checked the stock legs were horribly unstable. Updating AutoBalancingLandingLeg will have to wait until the stock ones are stable.
Are DestroyAll and RecoverAll wrapped into SmallUtilities itself? If so, are they updated to 1.1.2? I'm not seeing them in the stock toolbar button after installing 1.4.0 via CKAN.

> 
> 
> 3 minutes ago, curiousepic said:
> 
> 
> Are DestroyAll and RecoverAll wrapped into SmallUtilities itself? If so, are they updated to 1.1.2? I'm not seeing them in the stock toolbar button after installing 1.4.0 via CKAN.
> 

Yes they are. Are you seeing the KerboKatz cat in the toolbar? If not logs would be useful. If you do they should be in there somewhere.

> 
> 
> 2 minutes ago, SpaceTiger said:
> 
> 
> Yes they are. Are you seeing the KerboKatz cat in the toolbar? If not logs would be useful. If you do they should be in there somewhere.
> 

Nevermind! I did not realize they were only available in Tracking Station (could bear specific mention in description on front page).  Would be nice to have access in map during a flight though.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-05-01T14:43:30Z" title="05/01/2016 02:43  PM" data-short="8 yr">May 1, 2016</time> by curiousepic**

> 
> 
> Just now, curiousepic said:
> 
> 
> Nevermind! I did not realize they were only available in Tracking Station (could bear mentioning in description on front page).  Would be nice to have access in map during a flight though.
> 

I'll add that information. I'm not sure how Kerbal would react if i remove stuff while its actively using it. Time to find out!
Is there a reason why the EditorCamExtension was not updated to 1.1 and not included in any of the recent zips on github? Is it going to be depreciated now?
PhysicalTimeRatioViewer is a must for me, thanks for updating!

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, KocLobster said:
> 
> 
> Is there a reason why the EditorCamExtension was not updated to 1.1 and not included in any of the recent zips on github? Is it going to be depreciated now?
> 

It has a larger code base. It will be updated sometime soon.

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, Azimech said:
> 
> 
> PhysicalTimeRatioViewer is a must for me, thanks for updating!
> 

Always happy to hear something like this ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

[@SpaceTiger](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/133800-spacetiger/) I'm having some issues with your suite of Utilities (which are great by the way![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")). Log [here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/66mk1sr2th8ih24/Player%20%28Kerbo%29.log?dl=0) loaded with just module manager and your Small Utilities + Sampler. And the game hangs on the final loading screen.

There are a few other NRE's, but I think this one is the culprit. This is with the very latest version 1.4.1 from your GitHub page, installed manually. Linux 64 bit.

Cheers.

    NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
      at KerboKatz.Assets.AssetLoader.GetAsset[Sprite] (System.String name, System.String pathInBundle, System.String bundlePath, System.String dataType) [0x00000] in :0 
      at KerboKatz.FPSL.FPSLimiter.onGameSceneLoadRequested (GameScenes GameScene) [0x00000] in :0 
      at EventData`1[GameScenes].Fire (GameScenes data) [0x00000] in :0 
      at HighLogic.LoadScene (GameScenes scene) [0x00000] in :0 
      at PSystemSetup+.MoveNext () [0x00000] in :0

> 
> 
> 20 hours ago, SpaceTiger said:
> 
> 
> It has a larger code base. It will be updated sometime soon.
> 

Awesome, great to hear. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Log [here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/66mk1sr2th8ih24/Player%20%28Kerbo%29.log?dl=0) loaded with just module manager and your Small Utilities + Sampler. And the game hangs on the final loading screen.

> There are a few other NRE's, but I think this one is the culprit. This is with the very latest version 1.4.1 from your GitHub page, installed manually. Linux 64 bit.

It seems that one of the assets is corrupted or doesn't exist.I just checked the uploaded archive and it loads up fine  to me. Did you try re-downloading? That might fix the issue.

Will do.

On another note: will Craft History be making a reappearance by the way? I enjoyed that one a lot, and I like categorizing and organizing things, heh![^_^](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_happy.png "^_^")

> 
> 
> 5 minutes ago, Deimos Rast said:
> 
> 
> On another note: will Craft History be making a reappearance by the way? I enjoyed that one a lot, and I like categorizing and organizing things, heh![^_^](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_happy.png "^_^")
> 

As i said in its thread: Yes it will. We are currently working on it and it should be ready either this week or next week.

Apologies, I assumed it was a part of the Small Utilities Suite.

On the topic at hand: I downloaded all the mods again, threw them in my modded install, booted it up, same thing happened again. So then I cleaned out my install, completely cleaned out the KSP folder and reinstalled it fresh, downloaded a third time (and a third time from GitHub), and ran it clean with just Squad and Module Manager and it happened again. Log [here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/31kt4nez0000p4a/Player_KerboKatz02.log?dl=0). I verified my steam cache prior to running the game and all files came back 100%. By the way, is there a way to verify that I downloaded the same file that you upload (I think it's called like MD5-Sum or something?)

So if it's fine on your end, then something must be getting dropped in the transfer. I'm not using a download manager (just regular Firefox downloader). I could try downloading from somewhere other than github if you have alternative mirrors. Other possibility is a bad Module Manager download, which I doubt, but it's the only other file in the install.

I don't really need FPS limiter, so I could just remove it and see if that clears things up.

Thoughts?

----edit----

my md5sum for FPSLimiter.dll is 3c26fb8c50e1c775be1845cc19bcb8fe

----edit2-----

Removing FPS Limiter allowed my game to load, but I'm still getting a lot of NRE's from FPS Viewer. [Log](https://www.dropbox.com/s/qrwyx3umc0dq0j4/Player.log?dl=0)

**Edited <time datetime="2016-05-03T06:03:17Z" title="05/03/2016 06:03  AM" data-short="8 yr">May 3, 2016</time> by Deimos Rast**

I used this site:[https://md5file.com/calculator](https://md5file.com/calculator) | SmallUtilities.zip | (application/zip) - 165622 bytes | | --- | --- | | MD5 | 1d8f016700e9ffab10a6d9b793d4dd49 | | SHA-1 | 8c358c71830dc24f54129a5b2b22c518a3536a7e | | SHA-256 | e35db6c8b84250375491026dae58305fa69aa868329a9c9bcb9fef1c821fbbfa | | SHA-384 | e006268a7f3f02058eeadc8ec6d521d2339b7aca684260e8279613ff2db52e3179d314e470966ac5255b628fea9d356b | | SHA-512 |
6cc11894d30e58399fa07f6e88c87b7b6368035a6b1a97ea38f1a6d8b6b2700a42a9d71348b66eadfb0239719a9b7d8a09f5fe59c80a229d117c77900b7c08cc
| From the logs i can see that you are using Linux/Ubuntu which we don't have/didn't try it with but in theory it should work the same. Does this error happen just with stock as well ? There is a curse mirror that you can try. Removing FPSLimiter is an option that you could try as well. This could help in identifying if its an error in our code or if its just a corrupted file. Edit: Should refresh the page next time before replying. On another note this seems a lot like the file not being found. I'll create a new zip for you that has more logging. **Edited May 3, 2016 by SpaceTiger**

I did some edits (to my forum post), I tried with just stock yeah. I'm using Linux Mint. I'll run Md5 on the zip, one sec
